name.text: Determining the Surface Area of an Ice-Cream Cone Container

questiontext.text:
Mogaka, a Grade 10 student, sketches a diagram of an ice-cream container consisting of a conical container with ice cream at the bottom, as shown in the diagram below.

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-8, 18, 8, -8], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); const r = 6; const h = 10; // Base ellipse (top of hemisphere and base of cone) const base = brd.create('curve', [ t => r * Math.cos(t), t => 0.7 * r * Math.sin(t), 0, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: 'black'}); // Hemisphere: only lower half, sharing same rim (y ≤ 0) const hemi = brd.create('curve', [ t => r * Math.cos(t), t => 0.7 * r * Math.sin(t), // same vertical scale 0, Math.PI // from left to right, lower part ], {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2, fillColor: '#90caf9', fillOpacity: 0.6}); // Apex of cone const A = brd.create('point', [0, h], {visible: false}); const L = brd.create('point', [-r, 0], {visible: false}); const R = brd.create('point', [ r, 0], {visible: false}); // Cone sides brd.create('segment', [A, L], {strokeColor: 'black'}); brd.create('segment', [A, R], {strokeColor: 'black'}); // Height (dashed) const O = brd.create('point', [0, 0], {visible: false}); brd.create('segment', [A, O], {strokeColor: 'black', dash: 2}); // Radius on base (dashed) brd.create('segment', [O, R], {strokeColor: 'black', dash: 2}); brd.create('segment', [O, L], {strokeColor: 'black', dash: 2}); // Labels brd.create('text', [0.3, 5, '{#height_of_the_cone#} m'], {anchorX: 'left'}); brd.create('text', [-2.5, 0.7, '{#base_radius_of_the_cone#} m'], {anchorX: 'left'}); brd.create('text', [-4, 6.5, ' {#slantheight_of_the_cone#} m'], {rotate: -60}); /* Semicircle (lower half) */ brd.create('curve', [ t => r * Math.cos(t), t => -r * Math.sin(t), 0, Math.PI ], { strokeWidth: 2, strokeColor: '#1f3c88', fillColor: '#90caf9', fillOpacity: 0.6 }); [[/jsxgraph]]

Determine the total surface area of the sketched ice-cream container.

\(\text{Total surface area of the ice-cream}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The ice-cream container is made up of two solid shapes:

• a cone
• a hemisphere

Only the curved surfaces are exposed. The circular face where the cone and hemisphere meet is not included in the surface area.

From the diagram:

Radius of the cone and hemisphere = {@base_radius_of_the_cone@} m
Height of the cone = {@height_of_the_cone@} m
Slant height of the cone = {@slantheight_of_the_cone@} m

Step 1: Curved surface area of the cone

The formula for the curved surface area of a cone is:
\( \text{Curved surface area} = \pi r l \)

Substituting the given values:
\( \begin{align} \text{Area of cone} &= \frac{22}{7} \times {@base_radius_of_the_cone@} \times {@slantheight_of_the_cone@} \\ &=\frac{22}{7} \times {@R_times_l@}\\ &= {@Area_cone@}\ \text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

Step 2: Curved surface area of the hemisphere

The formula for the curved surface area of a hemisphere is:
\( \text{Curved surface area} = 2\pi r^2 \)

Substituting the value of the radius:
\( \begin{align} \text{Area of hemisphere} &= 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times ({@base_radius_of_the_cone@})^2 \\ &=2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@R1@}\\ &={@Hemisphere_area@}\\ &= {@Hemishere_Area@}\ \text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

Step 3: Total surface area of the ice-cream container

The total surface area is obtained by adding the curved surface area of the cone and the curved surface area of the hemisphere.
\( \begin{align} \text{Total surface area} &= {@Area_cone@} + {@Hemishere_Area@} \\ &={@SA@}\\ &= {@Surface_Area@}\ \text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The dimension of the Ice cream are}\)

\(\text{Radius}={@base_radius_of_the_cone@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The vertical height}={@height_of_the_cone@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The slant height}={@slantheight_of_the_cone@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The total surface area}={@Surface_Area@}^2\,\text{m}\)
